tool.name: SAGA.grid_filter.1
tool.command: $__tool_directory__/Code/openapi.py isArrayINPUT False output_data_RESULT $output_data_RESULT name SAGA.grid_filter.1 INPUT $INPUT SIGMA $SIGMA KERNEL_TYPE $KERNEL_TYPE KERNEL_RADIUS $KERNEL_RADIUS prefer $prefer response $response outputType_RESULT $OutputSection_RESULT.outputType_RESULT transmissionMode_RESULT $OutputSection_RESULT.transmissionMode_RESULT

param.name: INPUT
param.label: Grid
param.help: Grid The following data types are allowed in the txt file: png, x-ogc-aaigrid, x-ogc-envi, tiff

param.name: SIGMA
param.label: Standard Deviation
param.help: The standard deviation as percentage of the kernel radius, determines the degree of smoothing.

param.name: KERNEL_TYPE
param.label: Kernel Type
param.help: The shape of the filter kernel.

param.name: response
param.label: Response Type
param.help: Choose 'raw' for raw data or 'document' for document data.

section.name: OutputSection_RESULT
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format

param.name: outputType_RESULT
param.label: Author did not provide help for this parameter...

tool.help: The Gaussian filter is a smoothing operator that is used to 'blur' or 'soften' data and to remove detail and noise. The degree of smoothing is determined by the standard deviation. For higher standard deviations you need to use a larger search radius.
